properties.areaDesc: Howard; Red River; Hempstead; McCurtain; Nevada; Sevier; Little River
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 9 at 4:11AM CST until January 11 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport LA
properties.description:
...Flash Flooding Potential Increases Friday and Especially
Friday Night...

The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a

* Flash Flood Watch for portions of southwest Arkansas,
southeast Oklahoma, and northeast Texas, including the
following areas, in southwest Arkansas, Hempstead, Howard,
Little River, Nevada, and Sevier. In southeast Oklahoma,
McCurtain. In northeast Texas, Red River.

* From Friday afternoon through late Friday night

* A vigorous upper level storm system will have the potential to
bring excessive heavy rainfall to portions of the Middle Red
River Valley of extreme Northeast Texas, Southeast Oklahoma and
portions of Southwest Arkansas Friday Afternoon through Friday
Night before the storm system moves east of the region early on
Saturday.

* Widespread rainfall of near three inches will be possible with
isolated higher amounts. Since vegetation is dormant, more of
this heavy rainfall will become runoff and will raise the quick
onset flash flood threat.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT
